alert.note: Alert for Knott; Perry (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 7:46PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Perry and southwestern Knott Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 745 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms centered near Diablock, or near Hazard, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Bulan, Anco and Wiscoal around 805 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Cordia, Elic, Ritchie, Fisty, Emmalena and Ary. THIS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING HIGHWAYS... Hal Rogers Parkway between mile markers 57 and 59. Kentucky Highway 80 in Perry County between mile markers 9 and 15. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
